page.title: 02INTRODUCTION TO DEERNESS (2)
page.content: {Travel to Deerness}from mainland Scotland is by air to Kirkwall by sea from Scrabster to Stromness and in the summer months from John O' Groats to Burwick. The journey from Kirkwall, Stromness and Burwick must be made by car or bus as there are no trains. Most{services}are supplied from Kirkwall including police, fire, medical and veterinary, banking, mobile library, newspapers, milk and refuse collection. Students travel to St. Andrews 4 miles away for primary {education,}to Kirkwall for secondary education, and agricultural students to the centre at Weyland. Students for university or college education must travel to mainland Scotland. The {marketing of cattle and sheep}is through Kirkwall Auction Mart. Bulk tankers collect{milk}for the Milk Marketing Board creamery in Kirkwall.
